title: Vlyudyakh = My apprenticeship
subject_group: Literature/Russian literature - Film and video adaptations
description: The second part of a trilogy based on the memoirs of the writer Maxim Gorky dealing with early experiences that formed his outlook. In this part Alexei (Gorky) now a teenager, works as a servant, becomes an assistant cook on a Volga transport ship then an assistant to a painter of icons. Also available on 16mm and VHS. Part 1 (The Childhood of Maxim Gorki) available on 16mm, 35mm and VHS.  Part 3 (My Universities) of the trilogy available on 16mm and VHS. 'The Gorky Trilogy' also available as one title on VHS.  Credits: Director, M. Donskoi ; writers, Mark Donskoi, Ilya Grouzdez ; photography, Piotr Ermolov ; music, Lev Schwartz. Cast: Alyosha Lyarsky, V.C. Massalitinova, M.G. Troyanovsky.
